page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: {OLD PATCHAM.}The houses inchurch Hill (which is the oldest part of Patcham) were detatched,semi-detatched or terraced.The bottom of the hill seemed to be a bit older than the top.Fronts of the houses were made of flint from the middle downwards,otherwise they were cement rendered.Not many houses had garages.The houses had very small yards or gardens.Patcham Square contained very old flint built houses. {LADIES MILE ESTATE.}The houses are all detached or semi-detached and many are bungalows.They were built in the 1930's and show typical features such as carved windows and arches.The typical price new would be about Â£499 freehold!The houses are all privately owned and have garages and large gardens(Many have had considerable improvements such as extensions.)
